concept.title: Current Command
concept.shortdesc: If the user hovers over an element, the Current Command shows the user what will happen if that element is clicked.

conbody.p: Every command in HuViz has two parts: Verb + Set/Class. Both of these elements need to be chosen, by clicking on them, to perform an action.
Hovering over element will show the user what will happen if that element is clicked.
If no elements have been chosen, the Current Command will display the greyed out formula 'Verb + Set/Class' to indicate these elements are empty.
conbody.example: 'Select Book' indicates that clicking the class 'Book' will Select it, drawing it into the graph.

Hovering over elements in the Graph works the same way.
Here, clicking the Verb 'Label' and then hovering over the node 'D. H. Lawrence' shows what will happen if you click the node.
